Questions.Question: What is object-oriented programming?
Questions.OptA: A computer programming model that organizes software design around data, or objects, rather than functions and logic
Questions.OptB: A style of programming characterized by the identification of classes of objects closely linked with the methods (functions) with which they are associated.

Questions.Question: What are the four fundamental concepts of object-oriented programming?
What is a class?
Questions.OptA: User-defined data types that act as the blueprint for individual objects, attributes and methods
Questions.OptB: A template definition of the methods and variables in a particular kind of object

Questions.Question: What is an object?
Questions.OptA: Instances of a class created with specifically defined data
Questions.OptB: An abstract data type with the addition of polymorphism and inheritance

Questions.Question: What is abstraction?
Questions.OptA: Data abstraction means hiding the details about the data.
Questions.OptB: Control abstraction means hiding the implementation details.
Questions.OptC: One of the pillars of OOP.

Questions.Question: What is encapsulation?
Questions.OptA: The process of enclosing one or more items within a physical or logical package.
Questions.OptB: the bundling of data, along with the methods that operate on that data, into a single unit.

Questions.Question: What is inheritance?
Questions.OptA: Inheritance allows us to define a class in terms of another class.
Questions.OptB: mechanism where you can to derive a class from another class for a hierarchy of classes that share a set of attributes and methods.

Questions.Question: What is polymorphism?
Questions.OptB: the provision of a single interface to entities of different types, or the use of a single symbol to represent multiple different types

Questions.Question: What is the difference between object-oriented programming and structural object programming?
Questions.OptA: Structured programming allows developing a program using a set of modules or functions.
Questions.OptB: The object oriented programming allows constructing a program using a set of objects and their interactions

Questions.Question: What is the difference between a class and a structure?
What is Cohesion in object-oriented programming?
Questions.OptA: Shows the relationship within the module
Questions.OptB: The degree to which the elements inside a module belong together
Questions.OptC: How a single class is designed

Questions.Question: What is Coupling in object-oriented programming?
Questions.OptB: How classes interact with each other
Questions.OptC: the degree of direct knowledge that one element has of another

Questions.Question: What is a superclass?
Questions.OptA: a class from which other classes inherit code
Questions.OptB: the class from which many subclasses can be created

Questions.Question: What is a subclass?
Questions.OptA: classes that inherit one or more language entities from another class.
Questions.OptB: class that inherits state and behavior from all of its ancestors.

Questions.Question: What is the difference between static and dynamic polymorphism?
Questions.OptA: Static Polymorphism is where the decision to resolve which method to accomplish, is determined during the compile time.
Questions.OptB: Dynamic Polymorphism: is where the decision to choose which method to execute, is set during the run-time

Questions.Question: What are the three access modifiers?
What is an interface?
Questions.OptA: A blueprint that can be used to implement a class
Questions.OptB: A programming structure/syntax that allows the computer to enforce certain properties on an object

Questions.Question: What is a constructor?
Questions.OptA: A special method of a class or structure in object-oriented programming that initializes a newly created object of that type
Questions.OptB: A special type of subroutine called to create an object

Questions.Question: What is a destructor?
Questions.OptA: A member function that is invoked automatically when the object goes out of scope or is explicitly destroyed by a call to delete
Questions.OptB: a method which is invoked mechanically just before the memory of the object is released
